column2: VERMONT DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: Vermont

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Because many crashes happen when a vehicle is turning left, drivers should:
column4: slow down gradually while checking the rear view mirror.
column6: yield to oncoming vehicles, bicyclists and pedestrians.
column8: move into the left lane of a multilane road.

column2: 2. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Stop.
column8: Construction warning.

column2: 3. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left
column8: Sharp right turn
column10: A road joins from the left

column2: 5. Alcohol causes:
column4: poor judgment.
column8: loss of concentration.

column2: 6. Traffic lights are normally ____________ from the top to bottom or left to right.
column4: red, yellow and green
column8: red, green and yellow

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 8. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column6: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 9. Drivers approaching a green traffic light:
column4: must stop before proceeding through the intersection.
column6: always have the right of way.
column8: must yield to oncoming traffic before making a left hand turn.
column10: must merge to the left, if possible.

column2: 10. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: has the right-of-way.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column10: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 11. You must yield to other drivers:
column4: when they are driving a truck.
column6: when the other drivers are on your left and you have reached an unmarked intersection at the same time.
column8: when it helps to prevent collisions.
column10: when your traffic signal is a green.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column4: Railroad Warning
column8: Stop Sign Ahead

column2: 13. When driving through a work zone you should:
column4: pull over to the right side of the road and stop.
column6: slow down and pay extra attention.
column8: closely follow the vehicle ahead.
column10: keep a 2-second following distance behind the vehicle in front.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down or stop
column8: Stop if necessary

column2: 15. The yield sign means:
column4: If the way is clear, you may move forward slowly without stopping.
column8: Go. The light will soon be red.

column2: 16. Motor crashes are caused by:
column4: large trucks.
column8: errors on the part of the driver.

column2: 17. If a vehicle is approaching with high beams, drivers should look __________ until the vehicle passes.
column4: to the left of the road
column6: to the right of the road
column8: at the center of the road

column2: 18. If your car breaks down on the highway, you should:
column4: use your four-way flashers to warn other drivers.
column8: flash your headlights at oncoming traffic.
column10: sound your horn to warn passing vehicles.

column2: 19. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.

column2: 20. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: you must turn right.
column8: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
